sources.title: "When Knighthood Was in Flower" (1922)
sources.description: This gem is presented by Silent Hall of Fame.   Please visit https://silent-hall-of-fame.org/   to support our non-profit mission and the legacy of silent movie stars by making a tax deductible contribution.   FEEL FREE TO FOLLOW US ON TWITTER @SilentFilmGems     This is a short preview. You can watch the whole film here: https://silent-hall-of-fame.org/index.php/gems-for-donation   "When Knighthood Was in Flower" is a historical romantic drama and a swashbuckler. The events in the film occur during the reign of King Henry VIII of England. The king's sister Mary Tudor is in love with a brave young soldier, but is being forced into a hated marriage with an old and ugly monarch. Directed by               Robert G. Vignola Produced by             Cosmopolitan Productions Scenario by                Luther Reed          Based on                    the novel When Knighthood Was in Flower by Charles Major Starring                     Marion Davies, Forrest Stanley, Lyn Harding, William Powell, William Norris Cinematography        Ira H. Morgan and Harold Wenstrom Distributed by           Paramount Pictures Release date               September 15, 1922 Running time             134 min. Country                      United States Language                    Silent film, English intertitles   Copyright Disclaimer Under Section 107 of the Copyright Act 1976: "Allowance is made for "fair use" for purposes such as criticism, comment, news reporting, teaching, scholarship, and research. metadata.Plot: Mary Tudor, sister of England's Henry VIII, causes a stir by falling in love with a guardsman below her class.
metadata.Writer: Luther Reed, Charles Major, William LeBaron
metadata.Actors: Marion Davies, Lyn Harding, William Norris
